Class Library

java.lang.Object
Library
public class Library
extends java.lang.Object
Implements a Library Object that acts as an array to hold Book objects with helper methods. An array type Book is created to hold books in a single array. There are methods to interact with Library and the Books stored inside. Library is a growable bad data structure with an initial capacity of 4 that grows automatically.
Author:
Sahreb Aamir, Joshua Sennett

  • Constructor Details

    • Library

      public Library()
      Default constructor for creating a Library object. A Library is an array that holds Book Objects. It starts with an initial size of 4 with zero books.

  • Method Details

    • find

      private int find​(Book book)
      Method to find a book's index within the Library array. Given a book find() looks for the index of the Book within current Library array of Books that matches the given Book's serial number.
      Parameters:
      book - is passed a Book Object
      Returns:
      integer value of index of book within Library array.

    • grow

      private void grow()
      Method used to increase the size of the Library array by four. grow() creates a new array that is four indexes larger than the previous array.

    • getSerialNumber

      public int getSerialNumber()
      Allows other classes to get the starting serial number for this library.
      Returns:
      integer of starting serial number.

    • getBooks

      public Book[] getBooks()
      Allows other classes to access the array that holds the Book Objects.
      Returns:
      Book array that holds the books in the Library.

    • add

      public void add​(Book book)
      Adds a Book object to the Book array Library.
      Parameters:
      book - is passed that will be added to the Library.

    • getNumBooks

      public int getNumBooks()
      Allows other classes to get the number of books within the Library.
      Returns:
      integer of books within the library.

    • shift

      public void shift​(int deleted)
      Shifts the null spot within the Book array to the end of the array. Moves all books after the null spot down one index within the array.
      Parameters:
      deleted - integer index value where remove created a null index.

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(Book book)
      Removes a book from the array. Find the book's index using find. Deletes the Book object from its index and replaces it with null. decreases number of books by one if successful.
      Parameters:
      book - Passed Book Object that will be deleted.
      Returns:
      true if successful, return false if cannot find book.

    • checkOut

      public boolean checkOut​(Book book)
      Checks if book is checked out or not. If not checked out then checks it out.
      Parameters:
      book - Passed Book object that is requested to be checked out.
      Returns:
      true if checked out. False if not found or already checked out.

    • returns

      public boolean returns​(Book book)
      Attempts to return the passed book back into the library. Checks the book in the library and checks the status of checked out.
      Parameters:
      book - Book object that holds the checkedOut variable.
      Returns:
      true if the book was successfully returned, false is book doesnt exist or never checked out.

    • print

      public void print()
      Prints all books in library in current order to terminal.

    • printByDate

      public void printByDate()
      Print the list of books by datePublished (ascending). First sort the library in ascending order then print to terminal.

    • printByNumber

      public void printByNumber()
      Prints the list of books by serial number (ascending). First sort library in ascending serial number of books then print to terminal.
